intro: Islaya laui, commonly known as the Hawaiian starling, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers with five petals. The plant has delicate, narrow leaves that are opposite in arrangement, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Islaya laui is listed as endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species. Conservation efforts are underway to protect and propagate this unique species.
